alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:28PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Franklin and southeastern Douglas Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 328 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Baldwin City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baldwin City and Wellsville. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 189 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for east central Kansas.
